name: Kellie Blaise
bio: Originally from Dublin, Ireland, Kellie started her singing career at fifteen. She performed at The National Concert Hall for three consecutive years. Her song, "SLEEP," was nominated for an Irish Meteor Award for best song. She recorded her first penned album "No Prisoners," with world renowned producer Preston Glass (Whitney Houston, Natalie Cole, Aretha Franklin, etc.), and she trained under vocal coach Seth Riggs (Michael Jackson,  Barbara Streisand, etc.). Kellie starred in Ireland’s "The Voice" with Sharon Corr as her mentor. Kellie also has a blossoming acting career: Neil Jordan’s "The Borgias," "Doctors" and “Ill Behaviour"(BBC), “Deathrace 4,"(Universal) and the Irish films "This Day" and "The O’Brien's," for which she also composed.  Kellie most recently appeared in "The Shrink Next Door," opposite Will Ferrel and Paul Rudd. Most exciting of all, Kellie won a Screen Ireland Artist’s Grant to produce her screenplay, "The Life Of Reilly," in which she stars and sings.  The film is due for release 2022.

Ben with castmates at Cursed Child opening night

name: Jeff Lewis
bio: Best known as "Vork" from the popular award-winning web series, "The Guild," Jeff has been writing, acting, and performing improv and sketch comedy for decades, working opposite comedians such as Drew Carey, Kristin Wiig, Jim Belushi, and Andy Samberg, Currently, he Recurs as "Phil Hastings" on NBC's "Kenan" which just finished its 2nd season.  Other recent credits include Netflix's "Prank Encounters" starring Gaten Matarazzo from Stranger Things, HBO Max's "Winning Time" and Showtime's "Super Pumped."  In addition, Jeff is a content producer for the game show, "Funny You Should Ask."

name: Ben Papac
bio: Ben made his Theatrical debut as Albus Potter in Harry Potter & the Cursed Child, SF (2019-2022). He is also known for his roles on American Horror Story, HBO's Room 104, and Into the Badlands on AMC. Ben began his career in Atlanta and Baton Rouge, with roles in The Walking Dead, Fantastic Four, and others.

slideshow.alt: Ben Papac, Folami Williams, Jon Steiger

name: Fiona Rene
bio: Fiona Rene is a multi-ethnic Chinese American actress who just shot a Series Regular role on the CBS pilot, "Early Edition."  Currently, she can be seen on "The Lincoln Lawyer"(Netflix) and "I Know What You Did Last Summer"(Amazon).  Since being selected for the ABC/Disney Showcase, Fiona has starred in numerous TV shows: "Stumptown," "NCIS Hawaii," "SWAT," "Grey’s Anatomy," and "Jane The Virgin." Fiona also directs Immersive Theatre, writes content and has a successful voice over career.  She has a development deal for her TV script titled, "Scared Shitless,".  Fiona is the voice of "Freeform" and is well known for her mocap performance playing Sarah Bernhardt in "The Invisible Hours," one of the best reviewed games on PSVR.  She was recruited by Technicolor to lead a workshop in Acting for the Future- Interactive  Techniques for Immersive Live, VR and AR.
